UserTerritory2Association.name: UserTerritory2Association
UserTerritory2Association.description: Represents an association (by assignment) between a territory and a user record.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the user is active (true) or inactive (false) in the given territory.

RoleInTerritory2.description: The role of the user in a territory. Possible values are: Owner, Administrator, Sales Rep. Label is Role in Territory.

Territory2Id.description: The ID of the territory that the user is assigned to.

UserId.description: The ID of the user who is assigned to the territory.

UserTerritory2Association.accessRules: Standard and partner users can access this object. If a territory model is in Active state, any standard or partner user can view that model, including its territories and assignment rules. For territories in an active model, any standard or partner user can view assigned records and assigned users based on your Salesforce sharing settings. Users cannot view territory models in other states (such as Planning or Archived).
